column4: Kay guys -- a failed gutsy update broke the boot process on a Compaq F500. Anyone have a moment to help me troubleshoot, or have any experience with Gutsy on a similar laptop? Any help is very appreciated.
whats the symptoms?
Well, depends on the kernel flags I add. The Compaq F500 needed things like noacpi, irqpoll, and pnpbios=off to boot properly in Feisty...
ok. sounds like my problem..... i had to blacklist some modules and remake initramfs
So when I add all of those, it will get all the way through the boot process, and then freeze on a black screen --
and you cant switch with alt+F, etc?
No, I can't switch to any of the other terminals... (sorry, lots of chat messages to filter through!)
no old kernel to boot to?
here's the thing, I can boot into the recovery mode fine...
in that case, live cd + chroot.... and change your /etc/initramfs-tools/modules . . .
...but if I try to start gdm, it dies.
ahh... and if you startx?
Want me to su to a user, or try to startx as root?
try root.... (see if it works...)
Just black.
Now, to add another level, I think that some of the packages broke when I was updating.
So, things like ubuntu-minimal may be missing.
tried sudo aptitude -f install or /dist-upgrade ?
I'd like to fix those first, however, I can't get my laptop in recovery mode to see the internet.
I can get it to connect to my router, get an ip, etc, just not ping out.
in recovery mode, edit your modules file in /etc/initramfs-tools...
Okay, it's booting into recovery, what do I need to edit?
*what do I need to add?
